channel.title: Need an experienced coder who can help me with voids
channel.description: Okay i know this is really noobish...but ... Could someone just thoroughly explain what a void IS, what a void DOES, how you write a void... just all the basics of voids. I know its weird comin from a senior member but im still a noob lol.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 17, 2007, 09:04:29 AM[/size][hr]Wow goes to show how noobish everyone here is now... no experienced coders at all.

item.title: Need an experienced coder who can help me with voids
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

I don’t like the word “voids” by definition, Void means a vast open space filled by nothing, which is what most Voids are nowadays :(. They are actually methods that anything at any given time can call upon it to do THIS.

Void’s are usually used to call upon certain small amounts of information not huge chunks that would usually be in a Handler. (if you don’t shove everything in Client.JAVA you’re going to be much better off in the long run). Here’s a basic set up for a method with a switch method in it.

public void test(int ke) { switch(ke) { case 1: sendMessage("Congrats, you have just learned how a switch\nType works, now to move on to more complicated things."); break; case 2: sendMessage("Switch with an Integer in the brackets can be used to call upon a selection of a method rather than the whole method"); break; case 3: sendMessage("For example, after this method I will show you how to call upon it with another method."); break } } public void calltest() { test(1); sendMessage("You have just called upon switchID 1 of method Test."); }

Read full topic
item.source: Need an experienced coder who can help me with voids

item.title: Need an experienced coder who can help me with voids
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

Actually a void is an action ALL files can reach
thats why its called a PUBLIC void

how do you set up a void?

a void starts with his name and is followed by the action and what is going to happen

we also got voids with

IF’s and ELSE IF

we take a simple example

IF the kitten walks outside
STARTS RAINING

ELSE IF (the kitten stays inside)
SUNSHINE

another easy one in java language

public void farming() { if (playerHasItemAmount(5340, 1) && playerLevel[19] >= 1 == true) { pEmote = 0x831; deleteItem(5340, getItemSlot(5340), 1); addItem(5339,1); sendMessage("You plant the seed in the patch. Now water it to make it grow"); } else if (playerLevel[19] >= 1 == false) { sendMessage("You Need lvl 1 farming to plant this!"); } }
Human language … IF you got the seed and farming level 1
he does the action
ELSE IF (You DONT got the seed and / or 1 farming)
he will send a message
You Need lvl 1 farming to plant this!

This is the basic about voids

Read full topic
